Package com.mhealthatlas.apps.command

Interface IAndroidAppCommandService

All Known Implementing Classes:
AndroidAppCommandService
public interface IAndroidAppCommandService
Contains methods to mutate android application data.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.lang.Boolean deleteAndroidApp​(java.lang.Long appId)
    Deletes the specified android application if the application exists.
    Creates an outbox entity to start a new message transfer to exchange the deletion event of the android application with other services.
    java.util.Optional<java.lang.Long> relateAndroidAppWith​(java.lang.Long appId, java.lang.Long targetAppId, AppType targetAppType)
    Relates the specified android application with an Ios application.
    Creates an outbox entity to start a new message transfer to exchange the created relation event of the android application with other services.
    java.util.Optional<java.lang.Long> saveAndroidApp​(NewAndroidAppInfoDto androidApp)
    Create or update an android application / android application version.
    java.util.Optional<java.lang.Long> separateAndroidApp​(java.lang.Long appId)
    Separates android application from a related ios application.

  • Method Details

    • saveAndroidApp

      java.util.Optional<java.lang.Long> saveAndroidApp​(NewAndroidAppInfoDto androidApp)
      Create or update an android application / android application version.

      It is determined if the android application already exists based on the playstoreId.
      If the android application exists then it is checked if the android application data changed.
      If the android application data changed then the android application is updated and an outbox entry is created with the event type android_application_changed.
      If the android application does not exists then the android application and android application version is created and an outbox entry is created with the event type android_application_added.

      If the android application exists then it is checked if the android application version already exists in the databases.
      If the android application version exists then it is determined if the android application version data changed.
      If the android application version data changed then the android application version is updated.
      If the android application data has not changed but the android application version data then an outbox entry is created with the event type android_application_version_changed.
      If the android application version does not exists then the android application version is created.
      If the android application data has not changed then an outbox entry is created with the event type android_application_version_added.

      All created outbox entities are published on the android-application topic by the database monitoring service.

      Parameters:
      androidApp - the android application and android application version data
      Returns:
      the created/updated android application id, if the android application / android application version was successfully added or changed;
      an empty Optional if a required attribute is null in the NewIosAppInfoDto object or nothing is inserted or updated;

    • deleteAndroidApp

      java.lang.Boolean deleteAndroidApp​(java.lang.Long appId)
      Deletes the specified android application if the application exists.
      Creates an outbox entity to start a new message transfer to exchange the deletion event of the android application with other services. This event is published on the android-application topic with the event type android_application_deleted by the database monitoring service.
      Parameters:
      appId - the android application id
      Returns:
      True if the deletion was successful; False otherwise;

    • relateAndroidAppWith

      java.util.Optional<java.lang.Long> relateAndroidAppWith​(java.lang.Long appId, java.lang.Long targetAppId, AppType targetAppType)
      Relates the specified android application with an Ios application.
      Creates an outbox entity to start a new message transfer to exchange the created relation event of the android application with other services. This event is published on the android-application topic with the event type android_application_relation_changed by the database monitoring service.

      Currently only Ios can be chosen as the target application platform.

      Parameters:
      appId - the android application id
      targetAppId - the target app id
      targetAppType - the target app type
      Returns:
      the new created mHealthAtlas application id if the android application and the target application was successfully related;
      an empty Optional if the specified android application or target application does not exists or the target platform is not Ios;

    • separateAndroidApp

      java.util.Optional<java.lang.Long> separateAndroidApp​(java.lang.Long appId)
      Separates android application from a related ios application. Creates an outbox entity to start a new message transfer to exchange the deleted relation event of the android application with other services. This event is published on the android-application topic with the event type android_application_relation_deleted by the database monitoring service.

      This method should be called when the an android application was wrongly related with an ios application.

      Parameters:
      appId - the android application id
      Returns:
      the new mHealthAtlas application id of the android application if the android application is separated;
      an empty Optional if the specified android application does not exists;
